docs.lead_paragraph: Rates of the most common form of breast cancer dropped a stunning 15 percent from August 2002 to December 2003, researchers reported on Thursday.

headline.main: Breast Cancer Rate Falls in U.S., Study Shows

docs.lead_paragraph: At issue is psychiatry’s most bitterly divisive question: do antidepressant drugs increase the risk of suicide?

headline.sub: Suicide Rates at Issue in Drug Labeling;
headline.print_headline: Panel to Weigh Expansion Of Antidepressant Warnings

docs.lead_paragraph: Note: This lesson was originally published on an older version of The Learning Network; the link to the related Times article will take you to a page on the old site.
docs.abstract: In this lesson, students will examine the content of popular energy drinks by conducting research about stimulants and sweeteners. They then create posters outlining how these compounds affect consumers.
docs.snippet: In this lesson, students will examine the content of popular energy drinks by conducting research about stimulants and sweeteners. They then create posters outlining how these compounds affect consumers.

byline.original: By SARAH KAVANAGH and BRIDGET ANDERSON

headline.main: New York Calls in the Food Police (6 Letters)
headline.print_headline: New York Calls In the Food Police

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Re ''New York Bans Most Trans Fats in Restaurants'' (front page, Dec. 6): Kudos to the New York City Board of Health for adopting the country's first municipal ban on the use of all but tiny amounts of trans fat in restaurant cooking. This comes after the welcome ban on smoking in all public places introduced a few years ago, which has undoubtedly given a respite to the lungs of millions of New Yorkers.

headline.main: New York Calls In the Food Police

docs.abstract: Six letters comment on Dec 6 article on New York ban on trans fats in restaurants; Atul M Karnik, Dr Soja John Thaikattil and David Meyerson welcome ban; Joseph J Koechler says there are more dangerous products that are not banned; Jack Challem details dangers of trans fats; Harry Hussey disagrees with ban; drawing
